answers.answer: Well,  I'm sure they've told you your symptoms kind of fall into the category of "peripheral neuropathy".It's against the rules here to post links to other webforums,  but if you search on "peripheral neuropathy right arm" you get a bunch of different forums with people having your exact problem.Different thoughts about it - from vitamin B12 deficiency,  other nutritional deficiency,  diabetes,  etc.Best wishes.

You say that you are in the dental field, are you bending over for extended periods of time? The reason I ask is because our dentist has a  similar problem plus he is leaning over now even when he is just walking. He told me it is a hazard of his job for some people.
Sounds like you have allergies.Have you moved recently? Has your diet changed recently? Have you recently got pets?

question: I am in the dental field and for two years i have experienced a horrific sensation of burning in my right elbow with sensations of my skin crawling or having prickling sensations in my right arm and into my neck with swelling in the arm. Doctors have no clue thus far. MRI and EMG show nada! I'm at my wits end here. Any clue?
title: Please help me someone!!!
